step.command: ectool setProperty /myPipelineStageRuntime/ec_summary/prod-v2 'Prod-V2' ectool setProperty /myStageRuntime/prod-v2 "http://ci.idtplateer.com:8080/" ectool setProperty /myPipelineStageRuntime/ec_summary/consul 'Consul' ectool setProperty /myStageRuntime/consul "https://cs.idtplateer.com/" ectool setProperty /myPipelineStageRuntime/ec_summary/vault 'Vault' ectool setProperty /myStageRuntime/vault "https://vault.idtplateer.com/" ectool setProperty /myPipelineStageRuntime/ec_summary/prometheus 'Prometheus' ectool setProperty /myStageRuntime/prometheus "https://ps.idtplateer.com/"

formalParameter.defaultValue:
# -- Override the name of the chart. nameOverride: "" # -- Override the fullname of the chart. fullnameOverride: ""
# -- Replica count. replicaCount: 1
image: # -- Image repository. repository: gcr.io/google-samples/gb-frontend # -- Image pull policy. pullPolicy: IfNotPresent # -- Image tag. tag: v5
# -- Image pull secrets. imagePullSecrets: []
serviceAccount: # -- Specifies whether a service account should be created. create: true # -- Annotations to add to the service account. annotations: {} # If not set and create is true, a name is generated using the fullname template # -- The name of the service account to use. name: ""
# -- Annotations to add to the pod. podAnnotations: {}
# -- Security context for the pod. podSecurityContext: {} # fsGroup: 2000
# -- Security context for the container. securityContext: {} # capabilities: # drop: # - ALL # readOnlyRootFilesystem: true # runAsNonRoot: true # runAsUser: 1000
service: # -- Service type. type: ClusterIP # -- Service port. port: 80
# -- Resource requests and limits. resources: {} # We usually recommend not to specify default resources and to leave this as a conscious # choice for the user. This also increases chances charts run on environments with little # resources, such as Minikube. If you do want to specify resources, uncomment the following # lines, adjust them as necessary, and remove the curly braces after 'resources:'. # limits: # cpu: 100m # memory: 128Mi # requests: # cpu: 100m # memory: 128Mi
autoscaling: # -- If true, create a HPA for the deployment. enabled: false # -- Minimum number of pod replicas. minReplicas: 1 # -- Maximum number of pod replicas. maxReplicas: 10 # -- Target CPU utilisation for the pod. targetCPUUtilizationPercentage: 50 # -- Target memory utilisation for the pod. targetMemoryUtilizationPercentage: 50
# -- Node labels for pod assignment. nodeSelector: {}
# -- Tolerations for pod assignment. tolerations: []
# -- Affinity for pod assignment. affinity: {}
redis: architecture: standalone enabled: true auth: enabled: false master: persistence: enabled: true commonConfiguration: |- appendonly no
consul: enabled: false
imagenew: # -- Image repository. repository: harbor.idtplateer.com/guestbook/gb-frontend # -- Image pull policy. pullPolicy: IfNotPresent # -- Image tag. tag: latest
ingress: enabled: true ingressClassName: 'guestbook' annotations: alb.ingress.kubernetes.io/load-balancer-name: 'guestbook' alb.ingress.kubernetes.io/scheme: 'internet-facing' alb.ingress.kubernetes.io/target-type: ip alb.ingress.kubernetes.io/listen-ports: '[{"HTTP":80,"HTTPS":443}]' alb.ingress.kubernetes.io/certificate-arn: 'arn:aws:acm:ap-northeast-2:960249453675:certificate/3915d0da-6dd2-4384-8fb0-558b25bf1ff4' alb.ingress.kubernetes.io/ssl-policy: 'ELBSecurityPolicy-TLS-1-2-Ext-2018-06' alb.ingress.kubernetes.io/actions.ssl-redirect: '443' external-dns.alpha.kubernetes.io/hostname: 'devgb.idtplateer.com' hosts: - host: 'devgb.idtplateer.com' paths: - path: "/" pathType: Prefix tls: - hosts: - 'devgb.idtplateer.com'

If you do want to specify resources, uncomment the following # lines, adjust them as necessary, and remove the curly braces after 'resources:'. # limits: # cpu: 100m # memory: 128Mi # requests: # cpu: 100m # memory: 128Mi

redis: architecture: standalone enabled: true auth: enabled: false master: persistence: enabled: true commonConfiguration: |- appendonly no consul: enabled: true
consul: enabled: true
imagenew: # -- Image repository. repository: harbor.idtplateer.com/guestbook/gb-frontend # -- Image pull policy. pullPolicy: IfNotPresent # -- Image tag. tag: latest

If you do want to specify resources, uncomment the following # lines, adjust them as necessary, and remove the curly braces after 'resources:'. # limits: # cpu: 100m # memory: 128Mi # requests: # cpu: 100m # memory: 128Mi
autoscaling: # -- If true, create a HPA for the deployment. enabled: false # -- Minimum number of pod replicas. minReplicas: 1 # -- Maximum number of pod replicas. maxReplicas: 10 # -- Target CPU utilisation for the pod. targetCPUUtilizationPercentage: 50 # -- Target memory utilisation for the pod. targetMemoryUtilizationPercentage: 50

imagenew: # -- Image repository. repository: harbor.idtplateer.com/guestbook/gb-frontend # -- Image pull policy. pullPolicy: IfNotPresent # -- Image tag. tag: latest
ingress: enabled: true ingressClassName: 'guestbook' annotations: alb.ingress.kubernetes.io/load-balancer-name: 'guestbook' alb.ingress.kubernetes.io/scheme: 'internet-facing' alb.ingress.kubernetes.io/target-type: ip alb.ingress.kubernetes.io/listen-ports: '[{"HTTP":80,"HTTPS":443}]' alb.ingress.kubernetes.io/certificate-arn: 'arn:aws:acm:ap-northeast-2:960249453675:certificate/3915d0da-6dd2-4384-8fb0-558b25bf1ff4' alb.ingress.kubernetes.io/ssl-policy: 'ELBSecurityPolicy-TLS-1-2-Ext-2018-06' alb.ingress.kubernetes.io/actions.ssl-redirect: '443' external-dns.alpha.kubernetes.io/hostname: 'qagb.idtplateer.com' hosts: - host: 'qagb.idtplateer.com' paths: - path: "/" pathType: Prefix tls: - hosts: - 'qagb.idtplateer.com'

step.command: helm history my-guestbook -n qa kubectl scale statefulsets -l app.kubernetes.io/instance=my-guestbook --replicas=0 -n qa sleep 5 helm rollback my-guestbook 1 -n qa --wait helm history my-guestbook -n qa

kubectl exec -n qa -it my-guestbook-redis-master-0 -- redis-cli -h localhost save kubectl scale statefulsets -l app.kubernetes.io/instance=my-guestbook --replicas=0 -n qa helm upgrade my-guestbook guestbook-repo/guestbook -n qa --wait
